free_text.Learning outcomes: The main objective of the course is to introduce the participants to the new field of mathematical research known as "Applied and Computational Algebraic Topology"
free_text.Content: The course will describe most recent developments in a new rapidly growing direction of mathematical research which uses and develops topological tools to service problems of engineering and computer science. The course will cover a variety of topics such as stochastic algebraic topology, persistent homology, topological robotics, topology of configuration spaces of mechanisms and others.
free_text.Keywords: Stochastic topology, topological data analysis, topological robotics, topology of configuration spaces
free_text.Required prior knowledge: Basic knowledge of general and algebraic topology including homology and cohomology theory as well as Morse theory.

free_text.Contenu: The course will describe most recent developments in a new rapidly growing direction of mathematical research which uses and develops topological tools to service problems of engineering and computer science. The course will cover a variety of topics such as stochastic algebraic topology, persistent homology, topological robotics, topology of configuration spaces of mechanisms and others.
free_text.Mots clés: Stochastic topology, topological data analysis, topological robotics, topology of configuration spaces
